Type.Name: ReflectionPermission

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable ReflectionPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission

.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ReflectionPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IBuiltInPermission, class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

remarks.para: Without , code can use reflection to access only the public members of objects. Code with and the appropriate flags can access the protected and private members of objects.

block.para: Because can provide access to non-public types and members, we recommend that you do not grant to Internet code, except with the flag. allows access to non-public members, with the restriction that the grant set of the non-public members must be equal to, or a subset of, the grant set of the code that accesses the non-public members.

remarks.para: Certain features of reflection emit, such as emitting debug symbols, require with the flag.
For more information, see the enumeration.

summary.para: Controls access to non-public types and members through the APIs. Controls some features of the APIs.

remarks.para: Creates either fully restricted (None) or Unrestricted access to metadata.

remarks.para: A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

summary.para: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.

returns.para: A copy of the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target)
public override System.Security.IPermission Intersect (System.Security.IPermission target);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not an instance of .

remarks.para: The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.

summary.para: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.para: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is null if the intersection is empty.

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target)
public override bool IsSubsetOf (System.Security.IPermission target);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not an instance of .

remarks.para: The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\. If this method returns true, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.

summary.para: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.

returns.para: true if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsUnrestricted ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

remarks.para: An unrestricted permission represents access to any and all resources protected by the permission.

summary.para: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.

returns.para: true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission other)
public override System.Security.IPermission Union (System.Security.IPermission other);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission other) cil managed

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not an instance of .

remarks.para: The result of a call to is a permission that represents all the operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

summary.para: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.para: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
